radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Resolved with treatment at 5 years of age, showing regrowth of villi.

radiographic_examinations.findings: confirmed total villous atrophy and presence of antibodies to enterocytes.
focal spongiotic dermatitis with subcorneal vesiculo-pustule formation consistent with eczema.
subepidermal blister compatible with bullous pemphigoid.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Resolution of bullous pemphigoid led to persistent prurigo nodularis-like lesions.

radiographic_examinations.findings: demonstrated central ulceration with fibrin deposition, adjacent pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia, and mixed inflammatory infiltrate.
